label: 二条高倉殿
本: The Clear Mirror:  A Chronicle of Japanese Court During the Kamakura Period, (1185-1333) . Stanford University Press . 1998
見出し読み: にじょうたかくらどの
見出し読み_mod: にじょうたかくらどの
説明文: Also Nijō Palace. Imperial residence bounded by Nijō to the north, Oshigakōji [Oshinokōji] to the south, Takakuranokōji to the east, and Higashinotōji to the west; located on the site of the mansion handed down by Fujiwara Michinaga to his son Norimichi. Used as a palace by Emperors Kameyama and Go-Uda. Burned in 1278; rebuilt and used again by Go-Uda. Later used occasionally by Fushimi and Go-Nijō. [二条大路　押小路　高倉小路　東洞院　藤原道長　教道]
